availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phillip B. Hicks (McLean County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper. Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Jane Pruitt Hicks in Henderson County, Kentucky, on November 10, 1840. Father of Martha J. Hicks, Nancy Hicks, William Hicks, Charles W. W. Hicks, and Alice Hicks. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Employed David McFarland as a farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Hotel Keeper in McLean County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in McLean County in 1860. Enslaved Henry Hicks in McLean County in 1864.
